info.name: Hospital Backend API
info.description:
# API Documentation for Hospital Backend Rest API (v1)

This document provides the guides necessary to make use of the API for the project.

# Introduction

This API is responsible for carrying out all the activities as pertaining the functionalities of the Hospital Backend project.

## Overview

This API returns responses in JSON format at all times and always includes a status field to determine the status of the action requested and an accompanying message key. If the action requested was successful, the status would have a value of "success" and a value of "error" if the action was not performed or an error occurred while attempting to carry out the operation.

### Authentication

This API makes use of bearer tokens as the form of authentication for both users and drivers. This tokens are generated and returned at the point of login by a user or driver. This token should then be attached as the authentication header as a bearer token for accessing protected endpoints.

### Status Codes

The various HTTP status codes used throughout this API are modeled after RESTFUL conventions. They are listed below with relevant information.

| Status Code | Meaning |
| --- | --- |
| 200 | OK (The requested action was successful.) |
| 201 | created (A new resource was created.) |
| 400 | Bad request (something wrong with URL or parameters) |
| 401 | Not authorized (not logged in) |
| 403 | Logged in but access to requested area is forbidden |
| 404 | Not Found (the requested resource doesnâ€™t exist) |
| 422 | UnProcessable Entity (validation failed) |
| 500 | Internal server error (This is unintended and should be reported.) |

### Response Formats

The response formats for this API are quite similar in nature. For successful requests, the returned JSON structure is \['status' => 'success', 'message' => 'Response message', 'data' => \[\]\]. The data array in the success response is optionally empty.

For error responses, the returned JSON structure is \['status' => 'error', 'message' => 'response message'\]. However, for a 401 response, this comes with only a \['message' => 'unauthenticated'\] response structure.

## License

MIT
